item.title: Bio
item.dc:creator: gsanroma
item.content:encoded:
I obtained my M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in 2008 and 2012 from Universitat Rovira i Virgili (Tarragona, Spain ). In my thesis I developed structural pattern recognition techniques in computer vision. In particular, I integrated positional and appearance information into the graph matching problem.

In 2012, I joined the Intelligent Imaging group at the Dutch research institute TNO (The Hague ), where I worked on automatic recognition of complex threats. This work was done in the framework of the EU FP7 project ARENA.

In 2013, I joined IDEA group in University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (United States ), where I worked on multi-atlas segmentation with machine learning.

In 2015, I was granted a Marie Curie fellowship with SIMBIOsys group (Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Barcelona ), where I developed my research project on machine learning techniques for neuroimage analysis and segmentation.

Since October 2017, I am with the Population Siences group led by M. Breteler at the German Center for Neurodegenerative Diseases (DZNE, Germany ), where I am pursuing research on brain MRI analysis in the Rhineland Study, a big population study for helping understand the mechanisms of neurodegenerative diseases and determine effective preventive measures.

item.title: Software
item.dc:creator: gsanroma
item.content:encoded:
DeepLF: Learning deep embeddings for patch-based label fusion Discriminative patch-based label fusion with deep neural networks
Multi-atlas robust segmentation (MARS) Multi-atlas segmentation package featuring various popular methods
Smooth point-set registration using neighboring constraints Rigid and non-rigid point-set registration using graph-based representations

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.dc:creator: gsanroma
item.content:encoded:
Research experience:

  • Marie-Curie fellow with SIMBIOsys group (Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Barcelona, Spain) Neuroimage analysis and segmentation Jan 2015 - present
  • Postdoc at IDEA group (University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, USA) Multi-atlas segmentation Mar 2013 - Dec 2014
  • Postdoc at the Intelligent Imaging group (TNO research institute, The Hague, The Netherlands) Human behavior recognition from video Mar 2012 - Mar 2013
  • Ph.D. degree at SSAI group (Universitat Rovira i Virgili, Tarragona, Spain) Graph matching using position coordinates and local features for image analysis 2006/07 - 2011/12

Funded research projects:

  • Principal investigator of a Marie-Curie grant FP7-PEOPLE-2012-COFUND. Agreement n. 600387 Neuroimage analysis and segmentation 2015 - 2018
  • Part of the working team of Spanish MINECO project HOLOA DPI2016-80283-C2-1-R Clinical and virtual examination of patients for holistic and objective description of the osteoarthritis progression mechanisms 2016 - 2018
  • Part of the working team of NIH project 5R01EB006733-07 Development and dissemination of robust brain measurements
  • Part of the working team of EU project ARENA FP7-SECURITY. Project ID: 261658 Architecture for the REcognition of threats against mobile assets from Networks of multiple Affordable sensors Mar 2012 - Mar 2013

Commissions of trust

  • Leading organizer of 3rd MICCAI workshop on patch-based techniques for medical imaging Sep 2017
  • Guest editor for the special issue on the World Wide Web Journal: Internet and Web Information Systems [IF: 1.54] Oct 2017
  • Usual program committee member of international workshops:
    • IEEE workshop on performance evaluation of tracking and surveillance (PETS)
    • MICCAI workshop on machine learning for medical imaging (MLMI)
  • Usual reviewer of the following journals:
    • Pattern Recognition
    • Neuroimage
    • IEEE Transactions on Biomedical Engineering
    • PLoS ONE
    • IEEE Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics
    • Journal of Biomedical Health Informatics

Certificates and other merits:

  • Awarded an Nvidia GPU Titan Pascal X for supporting a research project on deep learning for medical image analysis Oct 2016
  • Research certificate by the agency for the quality of Catalan Universities (AQU) Required for applying to associate professor in any Catalan University Mar 2016
  • Editor's choice article for the contribution entitled: A unified approach to the recognition of complex actions from sequences of zone-crossings to the Image and Vision Computing Journal May 2014

Teaching and professional experience:

  • Adjunct professor at Universitat Rovira i Virgili (Tarragona, Spain) 2009/10 - 2011/12
  • Trainee at R&D team of the computer vision company Realviz (Sophia-Antipolis, France) Oct 2006 - Dec 2006

Previous education:

  • M.Sc. degree in Computer Science by Universitat Rovira i Virgili (Tarragona, Spain) 2008/09
  • M.Sc. degree in Computer Engineering by Universitat Rovira i Virgili (Tarragona, Spain) 2003/04 - 2005/06
  • B.Sc. degree in Computer Engineering by Universitat Rovira i Virgili (Tarragona, Spain) 1998/99 - 2003/04
